This app visualizes the eigenstates of the three-dimensional quantum harmonic oscillator. The hypersurfaces are defined as cross-sections of the probability density to find particle at a particular space point, which is defined by the square of the wave function of the energy eigenstate.\n\nEigenstate visualization is performed in OpenGL using the Marching Cubes algorithm. User can choose the eigenstate by specifying the quantum numbers n, l and m, as well the type of the wave function basis. It is also possible to regulate the level of discretization as well as the total probability to find the particle inside the drawn surface.
